articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Another child died of malnutrition in northern Gaza overnight and six people were killed and several wounded in renewed Israeli bombing of residential areas of Gaza City, Palestinian health officials said on Thursday.
articles.title: Girl dies of malnutrition in Gaza as Israel bombs north and south

articles.author: Daniel Ramos
articles.description: Bolivian armed forces took over the capital's central square on Wednesday, and an armored vehicle rammed through the entrance to the presidential palace followed by soldiers rushing in, igniting fears of a military coup.
articles.title: Bolivian soldiers surge into presidential palace, raising specter of coup

articles.author: Renju Jose
articles.description: Julian Assange spent his first night in 14 years as a free man back at home in Australia as the conservative opposition on Thursday cautioned the government against hailing the WikiLeaks founder as a hero.
articles.title: Australian leaders celebrate Julian Assange's freedom but opposition says he is 'no martyr'

articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: In the devastated village of Dolyna, Yurii maintains a lonely vigil. There were 500 residents living here – until the Russians came. Now there are a handful.
articles.title: In his home near Ukraine's front line with Russia, Yurii makes a stand

articles.author: Aaron Ross
articles.description: Kenyan police put up roadblocks on streets leading to the presidential palace on Thursday as some protesters vowed to "occupy State House" despite the president's climbdown on proposed tax hikes that sparked a week of demonstrations.
articles.title: Kenya braces for fresh protests despite president's tax climbdown

articles.author: Pesha Magid
articles.description: Hundreds of the pilgrims who died in fierce heat at this year's haj were not officially registered with the Saudi authorities, with the result that many had no access to vital services like air-conditioned buses and cool-off tents.
articles.title: Deaths at Saudi haj show challenge of shielding pilgrims from lethal climate

articles.author: Laurie Chen
articles.description: China's Communist Party on Thursday expelled former defence minister Li Shangfu and his predecessor Wei Fenghe for "serious violations of discipline", a euphemism for corruption, state news agency Xinhua reported.
articles.title: China's Communist Party expels two former defence ministers for corruption

articles.author: Kissima Diagana
articles.description: Mauritania's President Mohamed Ould Ghazouani has promised to accelerate investments to spur an energy and mining boom as he takes on six challengers in the June 29 presidential election.
articles.title: Ghazouani seeks re-election in Mauritania on the cusp of energy and mining boom

articles.author: Sabine Siebold
articles.description: More Ukrainian army recruits could receive basic training in Germany from next year if Kyiv moves some further military education back to Ukraine, an EU commander told Reuters, as the requirement for troops grows amid the ongoing war with Russia.
articles.title: Germany may hold more basic training for Ukrainian army recruits, says commander

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia on Thursday began a new trial of Robert Gilman, a former U.S. Marine who is already serving a prison sentence for attacking a police officer while drunk, and now faces fresh assault charges, the state-run RIA news agency reported.
articles.title: Russia starts new trial of jailed U.S. ex-marine Gilman, RIA says
